comments:
Build: I-200311191547
I was trying to replace my workspace project with another version from CVS and 
I got the following deadlock.  I'm not sure if it's a duplicate of one of the 
defects already open, in which case I apologize. I thought I should report it 
anyway.

Error Nov 19, 2003 19:26:38.72 Deadlock detected. All locks owned by thread 
Worker-49 will be suspended.
java.lang.IllegalStateException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.DeadlockDetector.reportDeadlock
(DeadlockDetector.java:388)

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Nov 19, 2003 19:26:38.62
!MESSAGE ThreadWorker-49 has locks: OrderedLock (0) and is waiting for lock 
OrderedLock (2)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Nov 19, 2003 19:26:38.62
!MESSAGE ThreadWorker-46 has locks: P/org.eclipse.pde.ui, OrderedLock (2) and 
is waiting for lock OrderedLock (0)
This one's a real deadlock between workspace lock and CVS lock. Moving to CVS.

The easiest way to reproduce is to checkout several groups of projects in
parallel. If the sets are overlapping but not identical it seems most likely.

We will investigate but my understanding is that Core would not call client 
code when the workspace lock is held thus avoiding the possibility of this 
type of deadlock. Was my assumption wrong? It appears that the workspce lock 
is held during a POST_CHANGE delta notification.

This is not a pressing issue as the excpetion is logged but everything 
continues as it did before. We can address it in M6.
*** Bug 47188 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 47231 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
We should not obtain our OrderedLock if the resource tree is locked.
The above modification has been submitted to HEAD
